introductions: Are you here to listen to my sermon, child? | Oh, so you're looking into [Victim]'s murder?  What have I to do with this? | You would implicate the Lord's servant in such a horrendous act?  How vile your soul has become.
openers: I hope you've made progress, detective.
You lack the amount of faith that I would hope to see from one who seeks to rid us of evil.
Have you come to listen to the truth, or to speak it?
I assume it's important if you're bothering me at this time, detective?
closers: Are you done with me, then?
You have some soul searching to do, child.
I hope to see you at mass, child.  You may need it the most.
itemYes: If you must know, child, I do own [Weapon].
itemNo: Child, why would I have a [Weapon]?  Of course I do not.
Are you truly so blinded to the truth child? | Embarrassing at is it to have to respond to such a statement; no, I do not own and did not use [Weapon] to kill [Victim].
That is nothing more than false, child.  I'll hear no more of it.
itemBut: My turn. Did you know that [Suspect] has [Weapon]?  The Lord sees all.
Since we are doing a confessional, then let me confess that I saw [Suspect] with [Weapon]. | Now go consider this elsewhere.
Let me add, that [Suspect] has [Weapon], and the Lord is surely watching [Suspect]'s actions with it.
startHintYes: May the Lord have mercy on [Victim]'s soul. | I cannot pretend to know the Lord's plan in this, but I will suggest looking into [Suspect]. | I saw [Suspect] with [Weapon] not long ago.
startHintNo: May the Lord have mercy on [Victim]'s soul. | I haven't a clue on where to start, detective, but I will pray for the Lord to enact vengeance upon the murderer.
motiveVictimGreenInnocent: It always seemed like [Victim] was at his beck and call. | Even if they differed in opinion, [Green] always insisted on having [Victim] as his doctor.
motiveVictimGreenGuilty: Would you truly expect a criticizer of wine and a vintner to get along?
motiveVictimYellowInnocent: Even those who do not follow the Lord have to find solace in something. | Her comfort was found in [Victim] tending to her husband until the end.
motiveVictimYellowGuilty: [Yellow] is anything but a follower of the Lord.  However, the week after her husband died she did join mass some times. | She spoke to me for advice once or twice.  I won't go into detail, but she showed concern that [Victim] may not have tried to save her husband. | The poor soul has not returned to the church since that conversation.
motiveVictimRedInnocent: Their relationship appears to be that of supply partners.  [Red]'s higher quality art supplies often come from [Victim] importing them to [Red] on visits. | Much of the art around the church was made by [Red] using [Victim]'s supplies, so I doubt that their relationship is sour.
motiveVictimRedGuilty: I understand her... disdain for [Victim].  She is a child of the Lord, and [Victim] has publicly denouced religion. | What would you do if someone publicly denouced your way of life?
motiveVictimBlackInnocent: During stressful times, the church is more filled.  Having a doctor in town generally calms the town down. | Those people often remain for a time after their troubles and are more receptive to learning when not stressed. | I would never curse the blessing that his visits bring.
motiveVictimBlackGuilty: [Victim] was... how do you say...  less than religious. I believe they were a fool to reject the Lord. | Look where that landed them.
motiveVictimBlueInnocent: I would be surprised to find out that [Blue] would want [Victim] gone. | He would have to work twice as much to deal with the citizens stressed by the loss of their most consistent doctor.
motiveVictimBlueGuilty: I cannot imagine that [Blue] cares for the man who promotes abstinence. | His confessionals, though, reveal a deeper hate of [Victim].  Why though, he would not say.
opportunityGreenGuilty: Before I went into the Lord's house for the night.  I saw [Green] at the [Location]. | He seems to defy the clock when doing work, doesn't he?
opportunityGreenInnocent: I didn't see him that night, mayhaps he was squirrled away in his winery?
opportunityYellowGuilty: A generous fool that one. She was visiting her late husbands gravesite.
opportunityYellowInnocent: That woman was seen visiting the graveyard. | I know her husband is with The Lord but I fear for her soul.
opportunityRedGuilty: The Lord works through her with the gift of art. | She was seen in the alley working her gift.
opportunityRedInnocent: I hear she was in the alley. Hopefully divining The Lords work onto canvas.
opportunityBlackGuilty: As a servent of the Lord I was reconnecting with Him that night.
opportunityBlackInnocent: As a servent of the Lord I was reconnecting with Him that night.
opportunityBlueGuilty: That fool needs to quit his devotion to the drink. | Devotion to The Lord should be highest priority. A church goer saw him passed out.
opportunityBlueInnocent: A man in his position should know to be more cautious with where he sleeps. He was passed out.
dunno: The Lord knows all, not me. If you want answers I suggest you seek him.
